archdesc.bioghist: The Freedom of Information Office responds to requests for information about the University of Michigan made through the Michigan Freedom of Information Act. In particular, this collection contains the set of requests that led to the Gratz v. Bollinger and Grutter v. Bollinger Supreme Court cases regarding affirmative action policies at the University of Michigan.
archdesc.scopecontent: The collection contains requests from 1995 to 1998 regarding admissions and affirmative action at the University of Michigan. Those making requests included Carl Cohen, Richard Cutler, Maryanne George, Thomas Giles, Rusty Hoover, David Jaye, Heather Kamins, Douglas Lederman, Michelle McManus, David Murley, Gerald Reynolds, Brent Simmons, Zack Sharon, Art Stine. Each file contains the original letter of request and the letter of response with resulting documents.
